timeline.author: xin-hedera

replies.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: it's slower than dataRangeFilter != null. overall it may not have much impact so my comment is a suggestion
replies.author: xin-hedera

replies.bodyText:
I didn't change this randomly, I had to change it for another reason to make the tests pass. I needed to differentiate between epoch and unset start date so made getLastValidDownloadedFileInstant() return null for latter. Without this change the filter was returning current time despite application status showing epoch.
Also, I'm not sure in what scenarios before my change that filterStartDate could be null, but I don't think it is correct to not put a date range filter even when filterStartDate is null and endDate is populated. That would cause end date to not filter.
Can you clear your review if you're okay with it?
replies.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
A [null start date i.e. EPOCH, MAX_INSTANT_LONG] has the same effect as a null filter since they both allow all timestamp values.
There are cases that filterStartDate is null when endDate is MAX_INSTANT_LONG (either not set or set to MAX_INSTANT_LONG):

startDate is set to <= lastFileInstant, so effectively we don't need a filter
startDate is not set and lastFileInstant is after EPOCH (i.e., there are stream files downloaded), we don't need a filter

That said, using a filter which will let all items in the downloaded stream file pass have no difference than a null filter.
btw, there is a corner case for DEMO network, when startDate is not set and there are already some files downloaded, the filter will be [EPOCH, MAX_INSTANT_LONG or the configured endDate]. This won't cause missing of items but it's just looser than what it needs to be.
Also, in getEffectiveStartDate, the change for DEMO network seems problematic, I'll detail it in a separate comment.
replies.author: xin-hedera

timeline.bodyText: nit: since lastFileInstant can be null, startDate after adjustment may be before EPOCH and it becomes the effective start date, previous logic would cap effective startdate to >= EPOCH
timeline.author: xin-hedera

timeline.bodyText: this will always set application status file name to EPOCH even there is a previous run which has downloaded some files. In that case, when startDate is not set, we should honor the timestamped file name in application status repository
timeline.author: xin-hedera
